  1. """Models for the ``frequently`` app."""
  2. from django.conf import settings
  3. from django.core.urlresolvers import reverse
  4. from django.db import models
  5. from django.utils import timezone
  6. from django.utils.translation import ugettext_lazy as _
  9. class EntryCategory(models.Model):
  10. """
  11. Model to gather answers in topic groups.
  13. :name: Name or title of the category.
  14. :slug: Slugified name of the category.
  15. :fixed_position: Set a position to avoid ordering by views.
  16. :last_rank: Last rank calculated at the category list view.
  18. """
  19. name = models.CharField(
  20. max_length=100,
  21. verbose_name=_('Name'),
  22. )
  24. slug = models.SlugField(
  25. max_length=100,
  26. unique=True,
  27. verbose_name=_('Slug'),
  28. )
  30. fixed_position = models.PositiveIntegerField(
  31. verbose_name=_('Fixed position'),
  32. blank=True, null=True,
  33. )
  35. last_rank = models.FloatField(
  36. default=0,
  37. verbose_name=_('Last calculated rank'),
  38. )
  40. def __unicode__(self):
  41. return self.name
  43. class Meta:
  44. ordering = ['fixed_position', 'name']
  46. def get_entries(self):
  47. return self.entries.filter(published=True).annotate(
  48. null_position=models.Count('fixed_position')).order_by(
  49. '-null_position', 'fixed_position', '-amount_of_views')
  52. class Entry(models.Model):
  53. """
  54. Entry model. Can be added to a category group.
  56. :owner: Foreign key to django auth user.
  57. :category: Entry can appear in different categories.
  58. :question: Title or question of the entry.
  59. :slug: Slugified question of the category.
  60. :answer: Answer or content of the entry.
  61. :creation_date: Date of entry creation.
  62. :last_view_date: Date of the last click/view.
  63. :amount_of_views: Amount of views/clicks.
  64. :fixed_position: Set a position to avoid ordering by views.
  65. :upvotes: Positive vote amount for this entry.
  66. :downvotes: Negative vote amount for this entry.
  67. :published: Shows/hides entries.
  69. """
  70. owner = models.ForeignKey(
  71. 'auth.User',
  72. verbose_name=_('Owner'),
  73. blank=True, null=True,
  74. )
  76. category = models.ManyToManyField(
  77. EntryCategory,
  78. verbose_name=_('Category'),
  79. related_name='entries',
  80. )
  82. question = models.TextField(
  83. max_length=2000,
  84. verbose_name=_('Question'),
  85. )
  87. slug = models.SlugField(
  88. max_length=200,
  89. unique=True,
  90. verbose_name=_('Slug'),
  91. )
  93. answer = models.TextField(
  94. verbose_name=_('Answer'),
  95. blank=True, null=True,
  96. )
  98. creation_date = models.DateTimeField(
  99. default=timezone.now(),
  100. verbose_name=_('Creation date'),
  101. )
  103. last_view_date = models.DateTimeField(
  104. default=timezone.now(),
  105. verbose_name=_('Date of last view'),
  106. )
  108. amount_of_views = models.PositiveIntegerField(
  109. default=0,
  110. verbose_name=_('Amount of views'),
  111. )
  113. fixed_position = models.PositiveIntegerField(
  114. verbose_name=_('Fixed position'),
  115. blank=True, null=True,
  116. )
  118. upvotes = models.PositiveIntegerField(
  119. default=0,
  120. verbose_name=_('Upvotes'),
  121. )
  123. downvotes = models.PositiveIntegerField(
  124. default=0,
  125. verbose_name=_('Downvotes'),
  126. )
  128. published = models.BooleanField(
  129. default=False,
  130. verbose_name=_('is published'),
  131. )
  133. submitted_by = models.EmailField(
  134. max_length=100,
  135. verbose_name=_('Submitted by'),
  136. blank=True,
  137. )
  139. class Meta:
  140. ordering = ['fixed_position', 'question']
  142. def __unicode__(self):
  143. return self.question
  145. def get_absolute_url(self):
  146. return reverse('frequently_entry_detail', kwargs={'slug': self.slug, })
  148. def rating(self):
  149. return self.upvotes - self.downvotes
  152. class Feedback(models.Model):
  153. """
  154. Feedback model to save and store user feedback related to an entry.
  156. This model can also be used to store general feedback.
  158. :user: Stores user if authenticated at submission.
  159. :entry: Related entry.
  160. :remark: User's feedback text.
  161. :submission_date: Date of feedback creation.
  162. :validation: Is this a positive or negative feedback.
  164. """
  165. user = models.ForeignKey(
  166. 'auth.User',
  167. verbose_name=_('User'),
  168. blank=True, null=True,
  169. )
  171. entry = models.ForeignKey(
  172. Entry,
  173. verbose_name=_('Related entry'),
  174. blank=True, null=True,
  175. )
  177. remark = models.TextField(
  178. verbose_name=_('Remark'),
  179. blank=True,
  180. )
  182. submission_date = models.DateTimeField(
  183. default=timezone.now(),
  184. verbose_name=_('Submission date'),
  185. )
  187. validation = models.CharField(
  188. max_length=1,
  189. choices=(('P', _('Positive')), ('N', _('Negative'))),
  190. verbose_name=_('Validation mood'),
  191. )
  193. def __unicode__(self):
  194. return "%s - %s" % (self.entry, self.submission_date)
  197. is_ready = getattr(settings, 'FREQUENTLY_READY_FOR_V1', False)
  198. if not is_ready: # pragma: nocover
  199. raise Exception(
  200. 'ERROR: There are backwards incompatible changes in django-frequently.'
